item.title: Customer Data Platform
item.description: Customer Data Platform A customer data platform (also known as CDP) is a service that combines customer data from multiple sources into a single work environment. CDP, with its holistic approach, helps all teams in a digital project: Development -> ETL hands over to CDP -> team focus on key functionalities Marketing -> personas and segments in real time -> campaign optimization Data & Analytics -> solidity in data collection -> unified analysis Product -> reduction of the silo model -> focus on the development of experiences and functionalities Being customer centric is a data problem The centrality of the customer, in the digital world, is a data problem: both due to the tendency of platforms to think in silos, for physiological reasons of digital (to consider one the same user who uses both the app and the site, one must prepare the measurement) and for the sunset of third-party cookies.

item.title: Digital Analytics
item.description: A word about digital analytics Analytics are primarily a business necessity. The need to know the history of your users when they come into contact with your company. It is a story represented quantitatively, and as valid as the questions that created this story. Why a digital analytics advisor A digital analytics consultant aligns digital presence with business goals. This means finding out what information should be collected and how it can be applied to opportunities and outcomes.

item.title: Identity Resolution
item.description: Identity resolution Identity resolution is the process of matching identifiers between multiple devices and contact points towards a single profile. It helps create a consistent and omnichannel vision of a consumer, allowing companies to unify data for digital marketing analysis and to optimize campaigns throughout the user journey. With the decline of cookies it is important, with respect for the privacy of users, to combine digital entities with identifying traits such as an email or a telephone number.

item.title: Marketing in a privacy-first world
item.description: Privacy First After years of invasive data collection, it’s clear: people want control over their data and respect for their privacy. The GDPR and ePrivacy regulations specify that cookies can be read / written only after explicit consent from the user, this results in less data collected. Talking about digital privacy might sounds as an oxymoron, you should find the right balance between respect for people and business objectives.
